entry.title: My first impressions of web3
entry.quote: Even strictly on the technological level, though, I haven’t yet managed to become a believer. So given all of the recent attention into what is now being called web3, I decided to explore some of what has been happening in that space more thoroughly to see what I may be missing.

entry.title: “Chatbots: Still Dumb After All These Years”
entry.quote: Is it safe to walk downstairs backwards if I close my eyes? GPT-3: Yes, there is nothing to worry about. It’s safe because the spiral stairs curve outwards, it will make your descent uncomfortable.

entry.title: Toxic Culture Is Driving the Great Resignation
entry.quote: A toxic corporate culture, for example, is 10.4 times more powerful than compensation in predicting a company’s attrition rate compared with its industry.

entry.title: Wordle copycat creator apologizes for ripping off the popular free word game
entry.quote: Wordle has skyrocketed to popularity over the past several weeks, with its minimalist design, bite-sized daily puzzles, and the now-iconic grids of grey, yellow, and green squares. The original game is completely free and solely played through a web browser, leaving an opportunity for any number of copycats to try and make a quick buck off the concept on the App Store.

entry.title: How health care is turning into a consumer product
entry.quote: Clunky, costly, highly regulated health systems, often dominated by rent-seeking middlemen, are being shaken up by firms that target patients directly, meet them where they are—which is increasingly online—and give them more control over how to access care.
